entry.title: The Merge Has Been Disastrous For Ethereum, Bitcoin Leading ETH On Key Metrics
entry.summary:
Kaiko‚Äôs¬†data on October 10 shows that the ‚ÄúMerge‚Äù has been a ‚Äúdisaster‚Äù for Ethereum‚Äôs performance. According to Kaiko, Ethereum has been trailing Bitcoin in price and volume since the critical upgrade was deployed on the first smart contract platform.¬†
The trend will likely continue, looking at the price and volume ratios of Ethereum and Bitcoin in recent days. A clear divergence shows that Bitcoin could be extending its lead over Ethereum, reinforcing Kaiko‚Äôs findings.
The Ethereum Merge: Shift To Proof-of-Stake
Ethereum is now a proof-of-stake network where validators, not miners, confirm transactions and secure it. Before the Merge, Ethereum was a proof-of-work blockchain reliant on miners. In late 2020, Ethereum operated on two networks in parallel, with the current PoS platfo‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
In recent events, the loans taken from Alameda Research have been scrutinized, with lawyers representing Sam Bankman-Fried, also known as SBF, seeking clarity from FTX co-founder Gary Wang.
SBF Lawyers Into The Loan‚Äôs Legalities
Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of the now-defunct FTX exchange, seems to be in a tangle over the loans given out by Alameda Research. Lawyers on his team are eager to question Gary Wang about the details and the legal counsels involved in the loans he received from the trading firm.
Last week, during the trial, the prosecutors delved deep into Wang‚Äôs financial activities. They pointedly asked about what they described as ‚Äúa series of personal loans‚Äù that ranged from roughly $200-$300 million.
These loans were notable as they were issued to Wang from Alam‚Ä¶

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Accused by Former Alameda CEO of Directing Fraud at FTX
entry.summary: Caroline Ellison, the former CEO of Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF)'s hedge fund, Alameda Research, has testified that the crypto mogul directed a scheme to defraud customers of his cryptocurrency exchange, FTX. Ellison's allegations painted a picture of ambition, deception, and misuse of customer funds by SBF. According to a report by Reuters, the former executive provided a detailed account of how an estimated $10 billion of FTX customer funds were allegedly misappropriated to repay debts and make investments. This move was allegedly orchestrated by SBF, who had set up systems allowing Alameda Research to access customers' funds. entry.title: Bitcoin Coinbase Premium Returns To Neutral, Buying Exhausted?
entry.summary:
Data shows the Bitcoin Coinbase Premium Index has declined towards neutral values recently, implying buying pressure may be running out.
Bitcoin Coinbase Premium Index Has Gone Down Recently
An analyst in a CryptoQuant Quicktake post explained that the Coinbase Premium Index has been decreasing recently. The ‚ÄúCoinbase Premium Index‚Äù here refers to the percentage difference between the Bitcoin prices listed on the cryptocurrency exchanges Coinbase (USD pair) and Binance (USDT pair).
The former exchange is used more by US-based investors (especially large institutional holders), while the latter has global traffic. As such, the Coinbase Premium Index can reveal the difference in the behaviors of the two demographics.
When the value of this metric is positive, it means that the cryp‚Ä¶

entry.title: Binance CEO‚Äôs Risky Bet: $1 Billion Rescue Fund Crashes
entry.summary:
In the wake of FTX‚Äôs collapse, the crypto industry was plunged. Prices plummeted, investors scrambled to cut their losses, and startup funding evaporated. Amid the chaos, the spotlight turned to Changpeng Zhao, the founder of Binance, as the last remaining tycoon in the crypto world after the swift fall of Sam Bankman-Fried.¬†
With a grand vision to rescue struggling startups, Zhao rallied industry leaders to raise a minimum of $1 billion. However, according to Bloomberg, the Industry Recovery Initiative (IRI) fell short of expectations nearly a year later, leaving the crypto market starved for cash and companies on the brink of collapse.

Attorneys defending ex-FTX chief Sam Bankman-Fried are keen to interrogate the former CTO of the now-dissolved exchange concerning personal loans ranging from $200-300 million, a fresh letter from Cohen & Gresser LLP reveals. A letter from the attorneys representing Sam Bankman-Fried seeks permission from the judge to allow certain lines of questioning during the cross-examination of Gary Wang, a witness for the prosecution. entry.title: Crypto Crisis: Bitmain Salary Suspensions And Exec Departures Amplify Chaos
entry.summary:
In the ever-evolving landscape of crypto, recent developments have sent shockwaves throughout the industry, further deepening what can only be described as a ‚Äúcrypto crisis.‚Äù¬†
The upheaval has been marked by financial struggles at major companies and notable leadership changes that are raising questions about the stability and future of the digital currency market.
Financial Woes Hit Bitmain
One of the most alarming indicators of the current turmoil is the recent decision by Bitmain, a prominent Bitcoin application-specific integrated circuit (ASIC) manufacturer, to suspend employee salary payments for September and beyond.
This news comes as a significant blow to the morale of Bitmain‚Äôs workforce, which has also had to contend with the elimination of bonuses and incentives.¬†

entry.title: Why Doesn't Hong Kong Allow Retail Stablecoins?
entry.summary: The global financial landscape is rapidly changing, owing in part to the rise of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. While several countries have taken a cautious yet progressive approach to digital assets, Hong Kong's position on retail stablecoins remains unusually restrictive. Recognizing Retail Stablecoins Before we get into Hong Kong's strategy, it's important to understand what retail stablecoins are and why they've gained traction in the realm of digital finance. Retail stablecoins are cryptocurrencies that are tied to a reserve of assets, often traditional currencies such as the US dollar or the Euro. These stablecoins provide the advantages of cryptocurrencies, such as speedier cross-border transactions and reduced costs, while reducing the price v‚Ä¶

entry.title: Decentralize Derivatives Trading with Custom Blockchain
entry.summary: David Gogel of dYdX discusses how the decentralized exchange is building a custom blockchain to fully decentralize derivatives trading. This shift aims to increase security and transparency for traders while maintaining the performance of centralized exchanges.

She notes the importance of flexibility as new crypto assets emerge and regulations change. Stacy Elliott interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: India's 1% Crypto Tax Has Been a Nightmare for High-Frequency Traders, Says Shardeum CEO
entry.summary: As India figures out its regulatory approach to the crypto industry, one thing is clear to Shardeum co-founder Nischal Shetty: ‚ÄúIf you're a high-frequency trader, you can't afford to lose a percentage every time you sell,‚Äù he told Decrypt's Andre Beganski at Messari Mainnet in New York. ‚ÄúThat's something that's caused a lot of issues.‚Äù

entry.title: Newly Partnered with Visa, Solana Focuses on Reliability
entry.summary: Solana has improved network reliability through upgrades like Quick and local fee markets. It recently partnered with Visa to allow settling transactions in USDC on Solana. This could enable merchants to receive instant payments and save on credit card processing fees. Stacy Elliott spoke with Austin Federa, Head of Strategy for the Solana Foundation, at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: We Need to Start Thinking About How we Make Crypto Easy to Use: Robinhood Crypto General Manager
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Robinhood Crypto general manager Johann Kerbrat at Messari Mainnet 2023, to talk about the trading platform's crypto wallet, onboarding new users through simplicity, and keeping platform fees sustainable.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Narrative Is Shifting Towards Layer-2 Solutions
entry.summary: Rich Rines, original Core DAO contributor and former Coinbase engineer, discusses how the narrative around Bitcoin is shifting in 2023. While Bitcoin remains digital gold, new layer 2 solutions are emerging to unlock more utility and value from the huge amounts of capital stored in Bitcoin. He says these innovations can benefit Bitcoin holders while keeping Bitcoin maximalists happy by building outside the base layer. Andr√© Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Regulation Threatens U.S. Dominance of Financial Markets, Says CoinRoutes CEO
entry.summary: Dave Weisberger, Co-Founder and CEO of CoinRoutes, argued that excessive regulation in the U.S. threatens to undermine the country's long-standing dominance in global financial markets. He warned that other countries are embracing blockchain and crypto to build more efficient digital markets, which could cause the US to lose its competitive edge and trillions in GDP. Weisberger said CoinRoutes is now focusing more on expanding internationally due to restrictive policies in the U.S. He was interviewed by Andr√© Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Explosive Growth Ahead for Enterprise Blockchain
entry.summary: Paul Brody drives Ernst & Young (EY) initiatives and investments in blockchain technology across consulting, audit, and tax business lines. He says enterprise blockchain adoption is nearing an inflection point. Brody believes blockchains will one day handle 40 billion transactions daily across industries like automotive and pharma. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Building a Developer-Friendly zkRollup to Scale Ethereum
entry.summary: Daniel Helm, head of Developer Relations at Scroll, discussess how they are building a zkRollup to scale Ethereum transactions and lower fees. He explained their focus on creating a seamless developer experience by maintaining Ethereum's ethos and tooling. Scroll aims to launch their mainnet soon, providing more scalable blockspace for Ethereum developers. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Base as a 'Bridge, Not an Island'
entry.summary: Coinbase's Jesse Pollak, creator of layer-2 blockchain Base, says the launch of the network has exceeded expectations, even if plans changed along the way. He believes Arbitrum One will help bring billions onto blockchain by enabling seamless user experiences. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.
